value.title: Implement row-level security
value.excerpt: Row-level security (RLS) allows you to create a single or a set of reports that targets data for a specific user. In this module, you will learn how to implement RLS by using either a static or dynamic method and how Microsoft Power BI simplifies testing RLS in Power BI Desktop and Power BI service.

value.title: Concatenate/ Merge columns with Power Query, the right way.
value.excerpt: Concatenating columns in Power Query is not hard to do, but depending on the technique you use, you might get unexpected or wrong results.  There is a bullet proof way to do it and I will explain it here.  Link to the null, blank video mentioned in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EoRjNx1G2g4

value.title: DAX Fridays! #14: SUMMARIZE
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function SUMMARIZE in DAX/ Powerpivot.  The function SUMMARIZE can return a summary of sales grouped around the calendar year and the product category name, this result table allows you to do analysis over the reseller sales by year and product category.  Source:https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg492171.aspx

value.title: DAX Fridays! #81: CALCULATETABLE

CALCULATETABLE allows you to create virtual tables that you can then filter using multiple conditions and use that table to make further calculations. value.title: Power BI Tutorial: 4 Ways To Get Data

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)
